info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:24AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River at Munfordville affecting Hart County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River near Mammoth Cave affecting Edmonson County.
Green River at Rochester affecting Ohio, Butler and Muhlenberg Counties.
Green River at Woodbury affecting Warren and Butler Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise with additional rainfall expected through the weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River at Rochester.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 46.0 feet, KY 70 floods one mile north of Rochester. At 47.0 feet, Rochester is cutoff. At 50.0 feet, Water approaches first floor of some homes in Rochester. Several county roads closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 40.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 34.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Friday was 40.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 50.6 feet early Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.7 feet on 03/07/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Butler, KY; Muhlenberg, KY; Ohio, KY
